titleInfo.title: Interior of Isaacs' Hardware Store in Leadville

physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: "167 Isaac's Hardware Store, Leadville, c 1909." Handwritten on back of photograph: "#167, Hyman Isaac's Hardware Store in Leadville btn 4th and 5th (420?) Harrison Ave. c. 1909, See Leadville file for description."

mods.abstract: Interior view of Hyman Isaacs' Hardware Store in Leadville, Colorado. There is an unidentified man in the center of the photograph who is leaning against a counter.
mods.note: Newspaper article with the photo titled ''Leadville Woman has Oldest Range in Rocky Mountains'' (undated) states that two individuals, Eva Zelezniker and Joe Matekal, owned the two oldest working Monarch coal ranges in the Rocky Mountain region. Monarch gave her a new electric range and him an electric griddle. The coal ranges had been purchased in Hyman Isaacs store in the early 1900s and had been advertised by Isaacs in the Herald Democrat as the ''Stay Satisfactory'' range.
Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, page 117.
